front.title: Security Mechanism Agreement for the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)

abstract.t: This document defines new functionality for negotiating the securitymechanisms used between a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) useragent and its next-hop SIP entity. This new functionalitysupplements the existing methods of choosing security mechanismsbetween SIP entities.Note that this internet-draft is simply a clean RFC 3329 in I-Dformat, and doesn't yet contain any changes compared to the original.
